Topic.Title: Agreed... buy apple sell google. .

Message.Msg: WOW! some smart people posting here on this thread! It's not just people screaming BUY or SELL. You guys have REAL reasons why apple will go up and goog will go down. I agree 100%, I've been trading aapl since jan last year and made good money on options up AND down. I am currently bullish on apple and bearish on goog. We are seeing a reverse head and shoulders on apple and a double top (which couldn't be broken along with parabolic move) on google. But I don't trade just on techincals alone. There must be events that move the stock to confirm the moves. Apple is going to have the WWDC soon in june (look at what it did for goog stock) which should break it out of the 100EMA. Also google has done nothing but keep going up higher and higher no matter what the news so why wouldn't people take profits here? They can't take profit in apple because there are none (most people are down in apple so they are holding). People are getting scared of fed pulling out their money in june so smart people will sell their winners before it's too late. This whoile market should not be this high. Unemployment still too high and housing is no where near where it was when DOW was at 14,000. Now people on the streets have been talking about getting into the stock market. That's when you need to get out. Summer pull back coming. I have calls in apple before the WWDC and puts in goog.

Topic.Title: New to Options. have a question...........

Message.Msg: If your new to options, it's not a good idea to start with a volatile stock like GOOG. First, you need to realize that out of money options lose time value faster than options in the money. This is especially true during the last 2 months of an options life. So unless GOOG goes under 775 soon you are s--------d. If you are still bearish, it's a good idea to roll up your puts to about $870. Better yet, sell off your position and learn to trade options before trading such a volatile stock. And if you have to ask what does volatility have to do with it? Then you are not ready to trade options at all.

Topic.Title: New to Options. have a question...........

Topic.Title: New to Options. have a question...........

Message.Msg: Here is a general rule. If you trade options long enough just like gambling you will likely mimick the long term average for option traders. That average is that 90% of option buyers end up losing their investment with the positions expiring worthless. If you sell options better have a good understanding of the company you are trading and have very good risk management procedures in place in case the position goes against you.

Topic.Title: New to Options. have a question...........

Stick with Bettertrades!!! Cuffs

Topic.Title: New to Options. have a question...........

Message.Msg: Options expiring worthless is a big negative. But you need to look at the 90% critically and ask why the trader didn't sell before expiration. Most of the time a trader will not sell if the transaction costs is greater than the remaining value of the option. So most of the 90% becomes just nominal positions or possibly they were hedges against other positions.
